references.reason: This paper introduces the foundation of diffusion models, a core concept extended in FIDE for time series generation.
This paper presents VAEs, a key generative model baseline that FIDE is compared against in the experimental section.
This paper introduces GANs, another key generative model baseline compared to FIDE, highlighting the relevance of generative models in time series.
This paper introduces TimeGAN, a GAN specifically designed for time series, directly relevant as a comparison model for FIDE's time series generation capabilities.

references.paper_title: CSDI: Conditional Score-based Diffusion Models for Probabilistic Time Series Imputation
references.reason: This paper is among the few that adapt diffusion models for time series, making it a relevant comparison and related work for the proposed FIDE model.
